headline: In Contact Centre Department

- good bonus for good performance (5months)
- OT pay
- additional allowance for those who speak Mandarin and do shift work
- shuttle bus provided from MRT
cons:
- so difficult to take leave (have to swap with colleagues if not appoved)
- alot of interns/contract take MC hence forever shorthanded (too much call volume)
- team managers are always asking us to avail and take calls (they even come to the toilet to pester you when you are on toilet break)
- shuttle bus stops at certain timing (if you OT you wont be able to catch it)

headline: MO BA/SA life is tough
pros: Management has general idea on how to run the ship right, SDLC is a good methodology for a product with high need for change and cadence of releases. Middle managers are receptive and open to communication.
cons: Not much training, expect to land on your own feet. Chances are people around you are toxic and incompetent, so SDLC fails because you can't change people even if you change processes. PMO quite incompetent in general, always underestimating costs and effort, no value-add in governance and stakeholder management. Business users are also incompetent and unsure, expect to handhold them and wear multiple hats to get the release across the line for them.

Not environmental friendly - Keep talking about digitalization but daily waste of paper is enormous.
